700509f-a.text:
1453-1457 Boston Road, west side, at the head of Bristow Street, showing the "Spy House", dating back to pre-Revolutionary days. It is said to have been the dwelling, during the American Revolution, of a spy, who enacted the same role as did Harvey Birch in Fenimore Cooper's story,'The Spy. For additional data see Randall Comfort's "Ristory of Bronx Borough; p 38. The house was razed some time between 1907 and 1911 and on its site now (1938) stands a 1-story brick building
bearing the above numbers.
1899.
0ift of Rancall Comfort.
